runs.comm: length ball close to off stump, blocked to short extra cover

fullish outside off and that's a wicket for Rajitha off his second ball in international cricket! I don't know if that stopped on Rohit a little. He checked his drive, and spooned it in the air for mid-off to catch diving to his right
length ball outside off, nips away a touch and carries through nicely after beating the outside edge. A bit of a nervous poke away from his body from Rahane
and again. Seams away once more, and Rahane's front foot is a little slow at this early point of his innings. Walks into the shot looking to drive that on the up through the covers
skips down the track now and Rajitha spears a wide down the leg side

back of a length outside off and this is a really quick outfield. Rahane just let it come on and hit the face of his bat, which was angled adroitly to place the ball fine, to the right of first slip and the left of third man, and it just raced to the boundary

and another! Two wickets in his first over! This one's banged in short, angling into the batsman, who looks to tuck it into the leg side with the angle, but it seamed away a touch, bounced a little more, and popped up off the leading edge for short extra cover to dive forward and take a good low catch
full, swinging down the leg side. Looks to flick and it swings past his bat and hits him on the pad
fullish, swinging into off stump, looks for the big drive but checks himself and pushes to midwicket
length ball, swinging in to beat the flick and hit Dhawan's pad again. Once again, the ball was going down the leg side
fullish on off stump, comes forward for the checked drive to mid-off
length ball on leg stump, swinging down leg again. Once again Dhawan misses the flick and is hit on the pad
length ball wide of off stump, not up there for the flat-bat drive, and Dhawan ends up dragging it into the leg side off the inside half of his bat. Perera begins with a maiden

greets Raina with a bouncer, and it lifts steeply through to the keeper, who leaps to take it above his head after Raina gets into an uncomfortable position, flinches, and gets his head below it. Called wide for height
fullish outside off, gets a good stride forward for a checked drive to mid-off
length ball outside off, pushed to cover
put down! Length ball on off stump and Raina goes for the big hit over the covers, clearing his front leg, and ends up skewing it high towards third man, where Gunathilaka drops an absolute sitter
length ball outside off and Dhawan goes for the flashy on-the-up drive. Ends up not middling it, and the ball pops up in the air, just over the reach of the outstretched bowler
length ball close to off stump, tucked away to the right of midwicket
Raina shimmies down the pitch, making himself room, and Rajitha shifts his line wider. Length ball, not quite up for the drive, and he reaches out and plays and misses
length ball on off stump and Dhawan slogs it away. Clears his front leg and swats it over the midwicket boundary, not quite off the middle of his bat but he made a decent enough connection
length ball on off stump, slower ball, poked towards short cover. Set off for an improbable single and Raina wisely sent him back
length ball on the pads, pitching outside leg. Misses the flick once again and the ball pops into the leg side for a quick leg-bye
fullish ball wide of leg stump, swinging further away. Raina looks to swat it away through fine leg but it's too far out of his reach
back of a length on middle and off, no room for the intended dab to third man, and he ends up blocking it back to the bowler
slower ball, back of a length on off stump, and Raina creates a bit of room and pokes it towards mid-off
length ball on middle and off, pushed towards cover point
oh man. Suresh Raina, what are you doing? A slog across the line to a length ball on the stumps, and it swings in, beats his inside edge, and only misses the off bail by a couple of inches
short ball, and he steps across it and whips it off his left shoulder, over short fine leg. Don't know if he intended to play it that fine
length ball on middle stump, and this time Raina doesn't lose his shape. Just clears his front leg and launches the ball over midwicket, hitting with the swing
full slower ball wide of off stump, Raina opens his bat face to dab to third man
slower ball, but this is a long-hop on leg stump, and the lack of pace is what keeps this down to two runs. Dhawan waits and swats it away to the left of the fielder at deep square leg

gone, and this time Gunathilaka holds on. Dhawan slogs at this length ball, which doesn't swing in this time but keeps going with the angle across him, and the top edge soars towards third man, where Gunathilaka falls to his right to take the catch
length ball on off stump, defended towards short extra cover
down the track comes Yuvraj, and that is a glimpse of Yuvraj Singh at his pomp. Senanayake floated this up right in his slot, and that big, free downswing sends the ball soaring over long-on
quicker ball on off stump, poked into the off side
fullish on off stump, driven to long-off
short ball wide of off, slows down a lot after pitching, and he has to reach out for a poke to cover point
quicker ball, slides down the leg side, past Raina's attempted leg glance
another quicker ball, slides on with the angle towards leg and middle stump to deny Raina room, punched back towards the bowler
short ball outside off, angling away. No footwork from Yuvraj as he goes for the back-foot slash, and the ball beats his outside edge
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, 139.3kph, slips past the outside edge again as Yuvraj looks to steer to third man with an open bat face
shortish on leg stump, no swinging room for the full-blooded pull, so he has to go for the short-arm jab to deep square leg
good, sharp bouncer - 142.5kph - and Raina ducks hurriedly under it. Probably was over head height, though not by much
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
shortish, wide of off, and Yuvraj is beaten again, late on the attempted slash. Didn't get his back foot across
once again, Senanayake slips a quicker ball down the leg side, a long way down this time
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length ball sliding on with the angle. Raina comes forward, looking for turn, looking for a push into the covers, and inside-edges it dangerously close to his stumps
quicker ball again. Seam-up, so it swung into Raina. His feet are in a tangle and the ball slides on past his inside edge and hits his pad
back of a length outside off, punched towards sweeper cover
length ball outside off, poked defensively into the off side

length ball on middle and leg and Sri Lanka have dropped another! Siriwardana this time, diving to his right at deep square leg, but he got both hands to it. Raina flicked it in the air, and that was a fairly simple catch, to be honest

doesn't really matter, because he's been cleaned up next ball. Pitches on leg stump and straightens to hit leg stump after Raina clears his front leg in an effort to make room for an on-the-up drive into the covers
fullish outside off and Dhoni shuffles across to whip into the deep midwicket region
short, slippery ball outside off, and India are five down! That hurried through and Dhoni, attempting to swivel into a pull, can only top-edge to the keeper, who took the catch over his head
length ball on off stump, presses forward and blocks back towards the bowler
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on for the soft-hands push towards point
full and wide, driven to deep point
length ball on middle and leg, pushed gently towards mid-on for the quick single
bangs it in short, and Yuvraj takes his eye off the ball as he swivels into a pull. 145kph, and it hits his left shoulder, deflects into the back of his helmet, and dislodges the protective bit there

another sharp bouncer, and Yuvraj is dreadfully late on the pull. Looked to take it from over his left shoulder, and ended up lobbing it in the air, and the bowler takes a couple of steps to his left to get under the simplest of chances
fullish outside off, driven to short extra cover
short ball rising over off stump, pulled along the ground to the right of deep square leg. Didn't get up that high and Jadeja could get his hands on top of the ball to roll his wrists over
short outside off, slapped away towards third man
looks for the bouncer, ends up bowling it down the leg side
full on middle stump, clipped towards long-on
shortish outside off, beats Jadeja's attempted cut. Played the shot with his weight on the front foot
short, close to off stump, leans his upper body away from the line to dab down to third man
beauty. Length ball in the corridor and it seams away to beat Pandya's defensive push. Opened him up too

good ball, follows up with the full, straight ball, and Pandya's front pad, perhaps pushing across as a reaction to being opened up the previous ball, is in the way of his bat as he looks to drive through mid-on. Can't get his bat around his pad in time, and the ball hits him in front. There seemed to be a chance that it might have slid down the leg side, though
shortish outside off, dabbed to third man
looks for the yorker, ends up as a  quick, low full-toss, and Ashwin manages to get his pad out of the way to meet it with a full face and clip to the wide long-on boundary
back of a length on off stump, blocked towards point
short outside off, the bounce is too steep for Ashwin to connect with the attempted uppercut
length ball outside off, gets on the front foot to defend into the covers
short ball on off stump, 143kph but it sits up a bit, and Ashwin checks his pull and plays what can be described as a pat into the midwicket region
bad ball, angling down the leg side, and Ashwin glances neatly off his hip to the fine leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on to tuck gently into the square leg region
short outside off, slapped to sweeper cover

length ball on off stump, Ashwin defends with soft hands, drops it down in front of point. Doesn't respond to Jadeja's call immediately, and he would have been out had the throw at the bowler's end hit the stumps
short and wide, cut away to the right of the fielder at sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, slower one, blocked back towards the bowler

gone, gone, plumb. Senanayake strikes first ball of a new spell. There's the one that goes with the arm again, from around the wicket. Jadeja comes forward to defend, plays for turn, and the ball slides past his inside edge and hits his front pad
tossed up outside off, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length, turning into leg stump. Goes back and tucks it away into the square leg region
quickish on leg stump, looks to clip it into the midwicket region, possibly looking for the single, but the bowler runs quickly to his right to cut it off
short and wide and Ashwin slashes it away, doesn't get over the top of the bounce to cut, and top-edges it thickly to the left of short third man
length ball angling down leg, clipped to the right of short fine leg

back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs to third man. Doesn't set off immediately for the single, but takes it in the end. Not sure he wanted to give Nehra the strike this early in the over
back of a length outside off, left alone. Nehra simply stood there and pulled his bat inside the line
length ball on off stump, lets it come on for a solid, soft-hands defensive push to backward point
fullish outside off, seams away and beats Nehra's defensive push. He was late moving his front foot out to that
length ball outside off, and a big cheer from the crowd as he shoulders arms confidently
slower ball, back of a length outside off, and they take the single after Nehra pokes it away through point
quicker ball, sliding down leg. Nehra didn't know much about it, plays down the wrong line while defending and it hits him on the pad
length ball on middle and leg, stays back and pushes down the ground to long-on
shortish on middle and off, pulled to deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump, defended to short cover
flighted ball outside off, gets forward for the checked push to sweeper cover
back of a length turning away from off stump. Ashwin keeps the strike well, goes back and across to whip it away through straight midwicket
length ball outside off, gets forward and lets it come on for the dab to third man. Takes the single first ball
length ball wide of off stump. Nehra pokes and misses
fullish on middle stump. Stays back to it and pokes it away into the covers
bouncer, well directed. Nehra gets his hands up quickly to protect his face, and fends it away into the square leg region
length ball outside off, Ashwin plays and misses, looking for the dab to third man

short ball outside off, steep bounce, and Ashwin was not sure whether he wanted to play it or not. Decided to play the uppercut/ramp late, and managed to elude the third man fielder sprinting to his left. Bounced just short of him and sped past
length ball, googly maybe, turned down the leg side after going past the inside edge as Nehra came forward to flick
inside edge, and that's the single into the leg side. Looked to drive through cover, but the ball, tossed up a bit slower, carried on with the angle instead of turning
shortish, close to off stump, not enough room to cut and he can't get it past backward point
quicker ball, and he's slid it a long way down the leg side
length ball outside off, no turn. Ashwin looks for the slash wide of point, but he's denied room and can't beat the fielder
this time he finds the gap. It's short enough for Ashwin to go back, wait, and pick his spot, late-cutting between backward point and short third man
tossed up on middle stump, driven to long-off
looks to clip an off-stump ball through mid-on, and the ball stops a bit and pops up off the leading edge, over the leaping bowler
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler

short ball outside off and they sneak a bye after Nehra took his eye off the ball, looking to duck. Ashwin called early and they steal a bye. Nehra was late taking off, the keeper underarmed it loopily to the bowler, who flicked at the stumps and missed, and they take an overthrow as well

back of a length on leg stump and Nehra backs away, looks to whip over the leg side, and gets a leading edge that lobs up and drops down for the keeper to take a tumbling catch after running towards point

oh my. What an end to the innings. Ashwin walks across his stumps to scoop towards fine leg, and ends up top-edging this length ball after the bowler followed his movement. The ball bounced between keeper and the fielder running in. Bumrah was coming back for the second, Ashwin sent him back, and he slipped as he turned, falling to the ground halfway down the pitch, allowing Sri Lanka to complete the simplest of run-outs
